title: Affinia Hotel Collection Celebrates National Book Month This October With The Launch Of Bookworms Program, A Book Drive & Author Readings

SOURCE Affinia Hotel Collection
Free Public Bookworms Events in New York City Hotels Throughout National Book Month Feature Travel Writers, Poets, and Legendary Editors
NEW YORK , Oct. 1, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- In honor of National Book Month this October, Affinia Hotel Collection celebrates its affinity for books and the power of reading. The five boutique hotels in New York City (Dumont NYC, Fifty NYC, Gardens NYC, Manhattan NYC and Shelburne NYC) will host a book drive in partnership with The New York Public Library to offer an opportunity for New Yorkers and guests to free up space and give their books a new home. Throughout the month, each of the five Manhattan boutique hotels will also host free reading receptions by noteworthy authors, which are open to hotel guests and the public.
This National Book Month celebration kicks off Affinia's new book club, Affinia Bookworms – an ongoing hotel program aimed at introducing travelers to notable writers and their works each month. Affinia Hotel Collection guests are able to purchase the "Bookworm Recommendation of the Month" through the hotels' grab-and-go shops .
Author readings begin on October 1 in the hotels' public spaces. The lineup draws from a diverse group of travel writers, editors, blogger and poets. Highlights include:
October 1st – Travel writer David Farley reading a short story from The Best American Travel Writing 2015 at Shelburne NYC October 3rd - Children's book author Charles R. Scott debuting his second book Daunted Courage at Fifty NYC October 8th – Renowned guidebook author Pauline Frommer featuring tips from Frommer's EasyGuide to New York City at Fifty NYC October 8th - Jacqueline Johnson poet and author of A Woman's Season reading for National Poetry Day at Manhattan NYC October 9th - Legendary editor and travel writer Don George reading from his brand new book The Way of Wanderlust at Fifty NYC October 13th - Veteran financial journalist, Rich Blake reading from SLATS: The Legend & Life of Jimmy Slattery at Dumont NYC October 26th - Travel blogger Nomadic Matt reading from his new book How to Travel the World on $50 a Day at Shelburne NYC "In a way, books and travel go hand-in-hand," said Lisa Zandee , Senior Vice President of Brand Management for Affinia Hotel Collection. "They allow us to journey beyond our limited perspectives, and they enrich us as humans."
At the close of October, Affinia Hotel Collection will be donating all collected books from hotel guests and New York residents. For more information, visit affinia.com/Bookworms.
About Affinia Hotel Collection
Just right for the modern traveler, each hotel in the Affinia Hotel Collection has its own distinctive personality. All five New York City hotels range in atmosphere from energetic and social to tranquil and private. Designed to offer guests more variety for a customized experience, the collection possesses a level of character not often found in hospitality.
The collection is unified by its convenient services and amenities: spacious, residential accommodations, complimentary Social Sips receptions, the VIPaws pet program, grab-and-go shops, and FreshDirect grocery kits. Inclusive packages offer guests special rates throughout the year, and offer direct access to neighborhood finds. www.affinia.com
